ASE-BOOSE-DOC
Table of Contents

Class AppFor

Namespace
Booseapp
Assembly
Booseapp.dll

Represents a for loop command. Parses loop syntax, initialises the loop variable, evaluates range/step, and controls program flow until the corresponding end for is reached.

public class AppFor : ConditionalCommand, ICommand

Constructors

AppFor()

Initializes a new instance of the AppFor class and sets the conditional type to commFor.

public AppFor()

Methods

CheckParameters(string[])

Validates that the for command receives a single parameter string.

public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameter)

Parameters

parameter string[]

The tokenized parameter list.

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown when the parameter count is invalid.

Compile()

Compiles the for loop by parsing loop variable, start/end expressions, and optional step expression. Ensures the loop variable exists and is an integer variable, evaluates bounds, and pushes this loop onto the program stack so that it can be matched by the corresponding end for.

public override void Compile()

Exceptions

CommandException

Thrown when the loop syntax is invalid or expressions cannot be evaluated.

Execute()

Executes the loop condition check. On first execution, initialises the loop variable to the start value. If the loop is out of range, jumps to the corresponding end marker.

public override void Execute()

IsInRange()

Determines whether the loop variable is currently within the loop bounds. Handles both positive and negative step values.

public bool IsInRange()

Returns

bool

true if the current loop variable value is within range; otherwise, false.

NextIteration()

Advances the loop variable by the configured step value. Typically called by the corresponding end for marker.

public void NextIteration()
